intro: Loricaria lagunillensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste loricaria, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found near rivers and wetlands. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Its ornamental value also makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
